Class Library

java.lang.Object
Library
All Implemented Interfaces:
ILibraryManagement
public class Library
extends java.lang.Object
implements ILibraryManagement
Class to represent a Library. The shelves and the clients are represented and there are methods to add publications to the library.
Author:
George Paul

  • Field Summary

    Fields 
    Modifier and Type Field Description
    private Vector<AbstractClient> clientList
    Vector to represent the list of clients of the Library.

    int to represent the next available id for clients.
    private int nextAvailablePubId
    int to represent the next available id for publications.
    private Vector<Publication> shelves
    Vector to represent the shelves of the Library.

  • Field Details

    • shelves

      private Vector<Publication> shelves
      Vector to represent the shelves of the Library. Vector was chosen as search is faster when data is sorted. Since the only way to add publications is via addLast, publications will inherently be sorted by id.

    • clientList

      private Vector<AbstractClient> clientList
      Vector to represent the list of clients of the Library. Vector was chosen for same reason as publications.

    • nextAvailablePubId

      private int nextAvailablePubId
      int to represent the next available id for publications.

    • nextAvailableClientId

      private int nextAvailableClientId
      int to represent the next available id for clients.

  • Constructor Details

    • Library

      public Library​(int shelfSpace, int clientSpace)
      Constructor method.
      Parameters:
      shelfSpace - the initial number of spaces on the shelves available to hold publications.
      clientSpace - the initial space on the client list available to hold clients.
